title: WebLADR
text: Custom callouts for learning LADR. 1. The custom scss must be referred in the YAML.

title: VectorSpaces
text:
definition: vector space


A \(vector space\) is a set \(V\) alond with an addition on V and a scalar multiplication on V such that the following properties hold.
\(\textbf{1. commutativity}\)
\(u+v = v+ u\) for all \(u,v \in V\)
\(\textbf{2. associativity}\)
\((u+v)+w = v+(u+w)\) and \((ab)v = a(bv)\) for all \(u,v,w \in V\) and for all \(a,b \in F\).
\(\textbf{3. additive identity}\)
There exists an element \(0 \in V\) such that \(v + 0 = v\) for all \(v \in V\).
\(\textbf{4. additive inverse}\)
For every \(v \in V\) there exists \(w \in V\) such that \(v+w=0\).
\(\textbf{5. multiplicative identity}\)
\(1v = v\) for all \(v \in V\)
\(\textbf{6. distributive properties}\)
\(a(u+v) = au+av\) amd \((a+b)v = av+bv\) for all \(a,b \in F\) and \(u,v \in V\).

\(\textbf{1. commutativity}\)
\(u+v = v+ u\) for all \(u,v \in V\)
\(\textbf{2. associativity}\)
\((u+v)+w = v+(u+w)\) and \((ab)v = a(bv)\) for all \(u,v,w \in V\) and for all \(a,b \in F\).
\(\textbf{3. additive identity}\)

title: VectorSpaces
text:
definition: vector space


A vector space is a set \(V\) along with an addition on V and a scalar multiplication on V such that the following properties hold.
1. commutativity
\(u+v = v+ u\) for all \(u,v \in V\)
2. associativity
\((u+v)+w = v+(u+w)\) and \((ab)v = a(bv)\) for all \(u,v,w \in V\) and for all \(a,b \in F\).
3. additive identity
There exists an element \(0 \in V\) such that \(v + 0 = v\) for all \(v \in V\).
4. additive inverse
For every \(v \in V\) there exists \(w \in V\) such that \(v+w=0\).
5. multiplicative identity
\(1v = v\) for all \(v \in V\)
6. distributive properties
\(a(u+v) = au+av\) amd \((a+b)v = av+bv\) for all \(a,b \in F\) and \(u,v \in V\).


Examples of vector spaces:

\(\mathbb{R}\) - real vector space
\(\mathbb{C}\) - complex vector space
\(\mathbb{F}^n\) - finite dimensional vector space
\(\mathbb{F}^\infty\) - infinite vector space
\(\mathbb{F}^S\) - the set of functions from \(S\) to \(F\)

::: defn-body
A $vector space$ is a set $V$ alond with an addition on V and a scalar multiplication on V such that the following properties hold.

$\textbf{commutativity}$

$u+v = v+ u$ for all $u,v \in V$

$\textbf{associativity}$

$(u+v)+w = v+(u+w)$ and $(ab)v = a(bv)$ for all $u,v,w \in V$ and for all $a,b \in F$.

definition: vector space


A \(vector space\) is a set \(V\) alond with an addition on V and a scalar multiplication on V such that the following properties hold.
\(\textbf{commutativity}\)
\(u+v = v+ u\) for all \(u,v \in V\)
\(\textbf{associativity}\)
\((u+v)+w = v+(u+w)\) and \((ab)v = a(bv)\) for all \(u,v,w \in V\) and for all \(a,b \in F\).


::::: prop
  ::: prop-head
  ::: prop-body
:::::


conditions for subspace


A subset \(U\) of \(V\) is a subspace of \(V\) if and only if \(U\) satisfies the following three conditions.
\(\textbf{additive identity}\)
\(0 \in U\)
\(\textbf{closed under addition}\)
\(u, w \in U\) implies \(u+w \in U\).
\(\textbf{closed under scalar multiplication}\)
\(a \in F\) and \(u \in U\) implies \(au \in U\)
